result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrik R Kriesel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office- $25.00 per month payment plan set to begin on 5-1-16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office- to be added to the monthly payment plan set to begin on 5-1-16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant. Must stop at the jail today.

Defendant Derrik R Kriesel in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 1115am CT goes through waiver of counsel with def. Atty Dan Firkus appears as friend of court. 1126am recess. 1133am back on record. Atty Firkus spoke with Def, Def moving forward. Atty Firkus is not opening file, acting as friend of Court. Def plea of G. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC.  SENTENCING:  $265.60 fine/cost & $200 DNA surcharge and DNA sample- stop at jail today. $25/mo beg 5/1/16 and the 1st of e/m thereafter. 1139am adj.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

Defendant Derrik R Kriesel in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL-clerk 2:31pm. Def not represnted by counsel today. Def wishes to move forward today. Def waives further reading. Def pleas guilty. CT does not accept plea at this time. CT accepts NG plea. 2:33 pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint.
